newsitem.title: USA: U.S. money market fund assets fell in Jan 15 week.
newsitem.headline: U.S. money market fund assets fell in Jan 15 week.

text.p: Assets of the nation's 652 retail money market mutual funds rose $85.5 million to $623.85 billion in the week ended January 15, the Investment Company Institute, an industry trade group, said Thursday.
It said assets of the 395 taxable money market funds in the retail category fell $383.3 million to $507.42 billion, while assets of the 257 tax-exempt funds grew $468.8 million to $116.43 billion.

The trade group said assets of the 318 institutional money market funds fell $2.03 billion to $307.86 billion. Of these, the 255 taxable money market fund assets decreased $2.00 billion to $276.34 billion, while assets of the 63 tax-exempt funds fell $29.8 million to $31.52 billion.
Total money market mutual fund assets stood at $931.71 billion in the week. Assets in the week ended January 8 were revised to $933.66 billion from $933.22 billion.
